meanings.sent1: The liquidity of the water made it easy to pour into the glass.
meanings.sent2: The company's financial liquidity allowed them to quickly pay off their debts.
meanings.sent3: The liquidity of the slime made it fun to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed with the liquidity of a river, smooth and continuous.
meanings.sent5: The liquidity of the paint made it glide effortlessly across the canvas.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily converted into cash.
meanings.sent1: Having cash on hand provides the necessary liquidity for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: Investors value the liquidity of assets that can be quickly sold.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to have a magical liquidity, turning coins into rabbits.
meanings.sent4: Her savings had the liquidity of a fountain, always ready to be accessed.
meanings.sent5: The liquidity of the market allowed for swift transactions without delays.

meanings.sent1: The river's liquidity was evident as it meandered through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The liquidity of the lava made it dangerous to approach.
meanings.sent3: The dance performance had a graceful liquidity to its movements.
meanings.sent4: His words had a liquidity that captivated the audience, drawing them in.
meanings.sent5: The liquidity of the wind carried the scent of flowers across the meadow.
